content:
Antimicrobial Resistance Gene Screening

The nf-core/funcscan pipeline screens bacterial genomes for antimicrobial resistance genes (ARGs), providing comprehensive AMR surveillance for clinical, public health, and research applications.

Critical Public Health Application

Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) is a global health crisis. This pipeline helps:

  • Track AMR Spread: Monitor resistance gene distribution
  • Inform Treatment: Guide antibiotic selection
  • Outbreak Investigation: Identify resistant strains
  • Surveillance: Population-level AMR monitoring
  • Research: Study AMR evolution and mechanisms

Tools Used

Multiple AMR detection tools for comprehensive screening:

  • ABRicate: Fast screening against multiple databases
  • AMRFinderPlus: NCBI's comprehensive AMR database
  • RGI (CARD): Resistance Gene Identifier
  • DeepARG: Deep learning-based AMR prediction

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with assembled genome contigs:

  • sample: Sample identifier
  • fasta: Path to assembled FASTA file

Key Outputs

  • ARG Lists: Detected resistance genes per sample
  • Resistance Profile: Which antibiotics are affected
  • Gene Annotations: Detailed resistance mechanisms
  • Summary Reports: Aggregated AMR findings

Clinical Applications

Clinical Microbiology Labs: Identify resistance genes in patient isolates to guide antibiotic therapy

Public Health: Surveillance of AMR trends in communities and hospitals

Outbreak Investigation: Track resistant strains during outbreaks

Veterinary Medicine: Monitor AMR in food animals

Perfect for: Clinical labs • Public health • Epidemiology • AMR researchers • Infection control
